item.title: Overwatch 2 Fans Aren't Happy With Kiriko's Recent Legendary Skins
item.description:
Highlights

  • Kiriko's recent Legendary skins in Overwatch 2 have sparked debates among players over their quality.
  • Some players question the criteria for labeling skins as legendary, as a few of Kiriko's legendaries seem to be Epic standard, as they have minimal changes like other purple skins.
  • Blizzard's monetization practices in Overwatch 2, including skin pricing, have been a point of contention among players since the game's release.

Some Overwatch 2 players aren't happy with Kiriko's recent Legendary skins. Overwatch 2 is known for releasing very creative skins for its heroes, giving them different appearances. That's normally the case with Kiriko, but a few of the support hero's latest skins are disappointing players.

Kiriko is a kunoichi healer who trained with Hanzo and Genji and relies on the help of her kitsune spirit to assist allies. The character has skins that range from Rare to Mythic tier, with examples including the Visual Kei and Sakura skins that have been released directly in the store. The Athleisure and Sukajan skins are examples of legendary looks, while other Kiriko skins have also stood out among players, such as the K-2000 Blademaster and Amaterasu, Kiriko's Mythic skin released in Season 3 . Kiriko has many skins that Overwatch 2 players can equip, but two have become the subject of discussion.

Related
Epic Overwatch 2 Skin Concept Makes Kiriko a Criminal Instead of a Vigilante

New concept art designed by one creative Overwatch 2 fan imagines what Kiriko would like as a villain instead of a vigilante.

Some Overwatch 2 players are unhappy with Kiriko's latest Legendary skins, as Reddit user Chair_Last points out. In the post they question what makes a skin Legendary, criticizing the quality level of the Terrible Tornado and Hashimoto skins. The Terrible Tornado skin is part of the collaboration between Overwatch 2 and One Punch Man , so the OP says they can understand the reason for the skin's tier. However, the Hashimoto skin that turns Kiriko into a member of the Hashimoto clan, a Japanese criminal group that was responsible for the death of Hanzo and Genji's father, is more questionable for players.

OW2 Players Debate Whether Kiriko's Latest Legendary Skin Deserves That Status

Several Overwatch 2 players agreed with the OP's argument, and some pointed out the "selling power" of skins, which would determine their high tier rather than visual quality. A second Overwatch 2 player said that given the number of Hashimoto Kirikos they had seen in their games, "the devs weren't wrong" in labeling the skin as legendary, as it likely made plenty of money. In another post on the Overwatch 2 subreddit , players said they don't intend to buy the Hashimoto skin. Some say the skin is beautiful, but "not worthy of being legendary" due to the similar clothing worn by the character, and that it's an "overpriced epic skin marked as legendary." That isn't the first time Overwatch 2 players have complained about legendary skins , highlighting a recurring problem with the shooter.

Blizzard's monetization practices have been the subject of controversy since the first Overwatch , and with the release of the sequel, the criticism from players has only increased. In addition to dissatisfaction with Kiriko's recent legendary skins, last month players criticized the price of Overwatch 2 's Mythic Prisms , the currency used to buy mythical skins.

item.title: Lucky Fallout 4 Player Never Has to Worry About Caps Again Thanks To a Wild Glitch
item.description:
Highlights

  • A glitch in Fallout 4 gives a player 99 million Bottlecaps, sparking debate among fans about whether game manipulation occurred.
  • However, the player says that they never manipulated the games, with no mods installed. Supposedly, they just got lucky at the Corvega Assembly Plant.
  • With Bethesda responding to reported problems with the next-gen update and planning a patch for Fallout 4 on all platforms, it will be interesting to see if this cap bug is fixed.

A Fallout 4 player took to social media to post about a glitch they claimed gave them over 99 million Bottlecaps after killing a Raider in an early portion of the game, and shared some photos as proof. In response, some Fallout 4 players debated whether such a glitch was possible, while others jokingly pondered what they would do with so many Bottlecaps.

The post came amid a resurgence in the Fallout series. Following the success of the Fallout TV series on Prime Video, games such as Fallout: New Vegas and Fallout 4 have seen their sales go up in response. Fallout 4 cracked the UK's Top 10 best-selling games list in April at the eighth spot. The timing of Fallout 4 's resurgence also aligned with its next-gen update, which came with enhancements to the PS5 and Xbox Series X/S versions. Although Fallout 4's next-gen update received mixed responses from PC players, that has not stopped fans from encouraging Fallout series newcomers to play the games that inspired the hit TV show.

Related
Funny Fallout 4 Clip Shows Brotherhood of Steel Stealing Player’s Power Armor

A Fallout 4 player shares a hilarious clip, which shows a Brotherhood of Steel soldier stealing a set of power armor from the gamer.

Despite Bethesda's titles developing a reputation for having glitches that can change a game in various ways, one player claimed that a bug made them the richest Survivor in the Commonwealth. On the r/Fallout subreddit, a Redditor named Arkayne97 said they shot a Raider outside the Corverga Assembly Plant and looted 99,999,999 Bottlecaps from them. Considering that the Corvega Assembly Plant is one of the first dungeons that Fallout 4 players will delve into, the enemies within usually do not carry many Caps. Arkayne97 shared another screenshot that stated their save file, called Atom, did not use any Fallout 4 mods.

Fallout 4 Player Finds 99,999,999 Bottlecaps on a Raider

Though certain Fallout 4 enemies have been known to drop some unexpected loot , some players responded to the post with differing opinions. While some Fallout fans made jokes about how they would spend over 99 million Caps in the Commonwealth, others debated whether any console commands were used to manipulate the game and change the amount of Bottlecaps an enemy can have. Some players also pointed out that Bethesda's reputation for bugs and glitches in their games can make underflow glitches possible on any item. It is unclear which version of Fallout 4 Arkayne97 played at the time of writing.

In response to some reported problems with the next-gen update, Bethesda announced that it will release a patch for Fallout 4 on all platforms on May 13 . Only time will tell which issues end up being addressed.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption 2 Fan Points Out Interesting Post-Game Interaction
item.description:
Highlights

  • Red Dead Redemption 2's post-game detail hints at Arthur's passing symbolically.
  • High-honor players encounter a deer at Horseshoe Overlook, tying back to Arthur.

A Red Dead Redemption 2 player online has discovered a fascinating post-game interaction in the Epilogue, which many players might actually be ruled out from encountering. If this detail is intentional, it's just another example of the massive level of detail found in Red Dead Redemption 2 .

Ever since the launch of Red Dead Redemption 2 back in 2018, the game has developed a reputation for a remarkable level of detail. Every inch of Red Dead Redemption 2 is crammed with something new to discover, and players can still find something fresh every time they switch on the game. One player even discovered a detail about Dutch in Red Dead Redemption 2 while modding , showing how this level of detail extends to the game's underlying systems, too. It shows what a labor of love Red Dead Redemption 2 was, and it's a big part of the reason why the game remains so popular almost six years after its initial release.

Related
Why Red Dead Redemption 3 Doubling Down on Realism Would Be The Right Move

2018's RDR2 was praised for its attention to realism, and Rockstar's next project should allow Red Dead Redemption 3 to take this to the next level.

Redditor xignaceh shared their interaction with the game's community online. While playing through the Epilogue of Red Dead Redemption 2 , the gamer decided to revisit Horseshoe Overlook, where the gang stays for a period earlier in the story. While there, they were slowly approached by a deer, which seemed to acknowledge John's presence before leaving.

Interesting Epilogue Deer Interaction in Red Dead Redemption 2

What makes this so fascinating is that for high-honor Red Dead Redemption 2 players , Arthur Morgan's animal is a deer. Other players in the thread reported seeing the exact same deer, but curiously, only on high-honor playthroughs. Redditor xignaceh confirmed that they themselves were also on a high-honor playthrough, leading many to theorize that this deer's presence at Horseshoe Overlook is an intentional detail, included by Rockstar to symbolize Arthur's passing. There were also several low-honor players in the thread, who couldn't recall having the same interaction with a coyote in the same location.

With new details like this still being found in Red Dead Redemption 2 , it's no surprise that players are being made to wait for a sequel by Rockstar. Every fan of the series has their own Red Dead Redemption 3 wish list , but the developer remains silent about the possibility of a sequel for the time being. With Grand Theft Auto 6 in the latter stages of development and gearing up for a 2025 release, it makes sense. While it's sad that players likely still face a long wait for Red Dead Redemption 3 , its predecessor suggests that it'll be well worth the wait.

item.title: Destiny 2 Making Exciting Change to Stasis Subclass
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Stasis subclass in Destiny 2 will be available for all players at no extra cost when The Final Shape expansion drops on June 4.
  • Free players are excited about accessing Stasis subclasses without needing to buy the Beyond Light expansion.
  • Stasis fans are hoping that more players using the subclass will push Bungie to introduce buffs and reworks for Stasis.

Bungie confirms an exciting change to the Stasis subclass in Destiny 2 , allowing more players to immediately access the subclass than ever before, as The Final Shape launches in June. Destiny 2 players have been clamoring for a change to Stasis subclasses for years as the "Light and Darkness" saga reaches its culmination.

Originally planned for release on February 27, Destiny 2's The Final Shape expansion will release on June 4 with new Prismatic subclass abilities, a comprehensive campaign experience, all-new activities, and so much more. The Final Shape also marks the end of Destiny 2's seasonal model as Bungie shifts to an episodic model in Year 7. Before the launch of The Final Shape , Bungie announced the "Expansion Open Access" period, which gives players access to the Shadowkeep , Beyond Light , and The Witch Queen expansions for free until June 3. Destiny 2's Expansion Open Access also gives players access to Year 6 seasonal content.

Related
Destiny 2 Fishing Clip Shows Why Players Should Pick Up Their Fish Often

A clip featuring an unfortunate fishing fail is circulating, demonstrating why Guardians should be picking up their fish frequently.

Pointed out by Reddit user OtherwiseFeedback679, Bungie's latest "This Week in Destiny " blog post confirmed that the Stasis subclass will be available to all players at no additional cost when The Final Shape expansion launches on June 4. Destiny 2 fans in the Reddit community are excited, since the change means that players will no longer need to buy the Destiny 2: Beyond Light expansion to access the campaign or Stasis subclasses for Warlocks, Hunters, and Titans. Moreover, players who want to own the rest of the contents of the Shadowkeep and Beyond Light expansions, including Exotics and dungeons, may purchase Destiny 2 Legacy Collection 2024 after The Final Shape launches. Although Destiny 2 fans must purchase the rest of the content from Beyond Light , the community is relieved that Stasis subclasses will finally be available for all players to use, regardless of the DLC they own.

Destiny 2 Players are Excited About Stasis Being Available to Everyone After The Final Shape Launch

Many are also excited about potential buffs and reworks to Stasis subclasses, since the subclasses will soon be used by more newcomers and returning Destiny 2 fans. The overall reception to this change appears to be highly positive, and many are optimistic that Bungie can make more adjustments ahead of the launch of Destiny 2: The Final Shape and beyond.

Bungie can build off the positive momentum of Destiny 2's Expansion Open Access period by ensuring a smooth launch of The Final Shape and providing a clear roadmap for the new episodic content once ready. Additional updates and tweaks to the Stasis subclass will also encourage players to continue using their Stasis powers for months and years to come. In addition, Bungie can avoid creating issues with the new Prismatic subclass by incorporating player feedback and learning from mistakes made with the Stasis subclass in recent years.

item.title: Elden Ring Fan Spots Shadow of the Erdtree Enemy That Has Serious Bloodborne Vibes
item.description:
Highlights

  • Elden Ring fans are already terrified at the prospect of Winter Lantern-like enemies making a comeback in Shadow of the Erdtree DLC.
  • An enemy spotted in some Shadow of the Erdtree art has players concerned that the Winter Lantern enemy concept is coming back, with the foe feared for how it builds frenzy when looking at a player.
  • Speculation is rife about this challenging new enemy in Elden Ring, with it possibly being a Death Blight version. With it shown lurking in some dark woods, players may need to use trees to break its line of sight.

An Elden Ring player has come across an enemy in one of the Shadow of the Erdtree artworks that resembles the Winter Lanterns from Bloodborne . Considering that these foes are regarded as some of the most frustrating enemies to deal with in Bloodborne , Elden Ring fans are already terrified at the prospect of the Lanterns making a comeback.

From featuring an intimidating new character Messmer to giving players more information about Miquella , Elden Ring fans are eagerly looking forward to exploring the Land of the Shadows. However, that excitement for Shadow of the Erdtree could soon be mixed with fear for some fans, as a player has come across an interesting detail that was missed by many but might end up giving nightmares to the Elden Ring community.

Related
Elden Ring’s Shadow of the Erdtree Should Lean on One Dark Souls 3 DLC More Than Another

Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree has a lineage of expansions to draw inspiration from and it will hopefully avoid the pitfalls of Dark Souls 3 DLCs.

In a new post on the Elden Ring subreddit, user Wild_Magician_7932 highlights an artwork that is featured on the Steam page of Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC . In the picture, players can see an extremely creepy-looking enemy lurking in the woods, with a swamp below it. While there are tons of interesting things in the picture, meticulous fans were quick to draw parallels between the enemy and Bloodborne's dreaded Winter Lanterns, a foe that quickly built up Frenzy when looking at players.

Shadow of the Erdtree DLC May Be Drawing Inspiration From Bloodborne's Dreaded Winter Lanterns

The idea of Winter Lanterns being featured in Elden Ring has surfaced in the community in the past as well, as they are extremely challenging to deal with and fit FromSoftware's approach of notoriously difficult expansions. User LargeRichardJohnson highlights that the connection doesn't seem that far-fetched considering the fact that its appearance gives the vibe that it could possibly be a Frenzied Flame version of the enemy, which is similar to the Frenzy buildup by Winter Lanterns. That being said, players are a bit divided on that, with many advocating for the fact that the color theme suggests that it is a Death Blight enemy instead, which is in fact even worse to deal with.

Players are already saying that they'd be lucky if it is a Frenzied Flame version instead of Death Blight, as the latter would be extremely difficult to deal with. Another interesting theory is that the trees in the background would serve as a way to avoid the line of sight of the enemy. With poison swamps already confirmed for Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, it wouldn't be surprising if the expansion had a big threat like this to dread.
